extendedIngredients.name: apple
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1½ cups peeled, diced apple (I use Granny Smith)

extendedIngredients.name: artificial vanilla flavoring
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ teaspoon pure vanilla flavoring or extract

extendedIngredients.name: baking powder
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon baking powder (1/2 teaspoon above 3000 ft)

extendedIngredients.name: baking soda
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ teaspoon baking soda

extendedIngredients.name: brown sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup packed brown sugar (see post above for unrefined option)

extendedIngredients.name: coconut cream
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup chilled coconut cream**

extendedIngredients.name: Dairy Free Cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 ounces dairy-free cream cheese alternative (I used ½ container of Daiya Original)
metaInformation: (I used ½ container of Daiya Original)

extendedIngredients.name: dairy milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: ⅔ cup unsweetened dairy-free milk beverage, lukewarm

extendedIngredients.name: gluten-free flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups all-purpose gluten-free flour (I used Enjoy Life All-Purpose Flour with Ancient Grains*)

extendedIngredients.name: ground cinnamon
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ teaspoon ground cinnamon

extendedIngredients.name: ground flaxseed
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons ground flaxseed

extendedIngredients.name: maple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup maple syrup

extendedIngredients.name: powdered sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ to 1½ cups powdered sugar (see post above for unrefined option)

extendedIngredients.name: pumpkin pie spice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1¼ teaspoons pumpkin pie spice

extendedIngredients.name: pumpkin puree
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup pumpkin puree

extendedIngredients.name: rice bran oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup rice bran oil (or other neutral baking oil)

extendedIngredients.name: salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ teaspoon salt

extendedIngredients.name: salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Pinch salt

extendedIngredients.name: sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup sugar (see post above for unrefined option)

extendedIngredients.name: vanilla extract
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

recipes.title: Pumpkin Apple Pie Cake (Vegan and Gluten-Free)

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are my top picks for Cake. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. The NV Solera Cream Sherry with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat your oven to 350 and grease a 9-inch baking dish.In a large bowl, whisk together the flour blend, pie spice, baking powder, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt. Stir in the apples, to coat.In a mixing bowl, blend the pumpkin, sugars, oil, maple, flaxseed, and vanilla until smooth. Stir in the milk beverage, followed by the flour / apple mixture, stirring until just combined.Pour the batter into your prepared pan, leveling out as needed. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes, or until the cake has pulled away from the sides and the center springs back when lightly pressed.Let cool completely before cutting, and preferably for several hours or even overnight. The cake will become quite cohesive and the flavors will meld as it sits. Will keep for about 2 to 3 days covered at room temperature, or longer if chilled.If desired, frost before serving.In a chilled mixing bowl, blend the cream cheese alternative, coconut cream, vanilla, and salt until just combined.Beat in the powdered sugar, to taste. I prefer  to 1 cup, but you might like it cheesier or sweeter.If the frosting softens too much, simply cover and chill in the refrigerator. It should be a soft, but thick and spreadable consistency.

steps.step: Preheat your oven to 350 and grease a 9-inch baking dish.In a large bowl, whisk together the flour blend, pie spice, baking powder, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt. Stir in the apples, to coat.In a mixing bowl, blend the pumpkin, sugars, oil, maple, flaxseed, and vanilla until smooth. Stir in the milk beverage, followed by the flour / apple mixture, stirring until just combined.
Pour the batter into your prepared pan, leveling out as needed.
Bake for 45 to 55 minutes, or until the cake has pulled away from the sides and the center springs back when lightly pressed.

Let cool completely before cutting, and preferably for several hours or even overnight. The cake will become quite cohesive and the flavors will meld as it sits. Will keep for about 2 to 3 days covered at room temperature, or longer if chilled.If desired, frost before serving.In a chilled mixing bowl, blend the cream cheese alternative, coconut cream, vanilla, and salt until just combined.Beat in the powdered sugar, to taste. I prefer  to 1 cup, but you might like it cheesier or sweeter.If the frosting softens too much, simply cover and chill in the refrigerator. It should be a soft, but thick and spreadable consistency.
